subtitleNullable: 4.5k images, 8k annotations, 55 classes, 640x640 px - google maps images
descriptionNullable: ## Dataset structure The dataset contains 55 classes of unique traffic signs. There are 4 main categories: * forb * info * mand * warn Each class has one of these prefixes in it's name indicating the category of the traffic sign: forbidden, informational, mandatory and warning, respectively. It's pretty useful for experimenting. ## General info * Each image is of size 640x640px, natural size no stretching or shrinking. * Labels are manually double checked, a lot of labeling mistakes were fixed. * Not balanced due to the natural frequency of signs. (crosswalks are everywhere) * Contains images with no labels, mostly of False Positive detections. NOTE (20-02-24): Update to version 2. Added 2k new images and double checked the labels for mistakes. I appreciate any feedback, ideas or whatever you have to say, It's my first dataset and I'm trying to make it as good as I can. I'll probably add more classes in the future, there are a lot of unlabeled traffic signs present in the existing data.
title: Traffic Signs Detection
subtitle: 4.5k images, 8k annotations, 55 classes, 640x640 px - google maps images
description: ## Dataset structure The dataset contains 55 classes of unique traffic signs. There are 4 main categories: * forb * info * mand * warn Each class has one of these prefixes in it's name indicating the category of the traffic sign: forbidden, informational, mandatory and warning, respectively. It's pretty useful for experimenting. ## General info * Each image is of size 640x640px, natural size no stretching or shrinking. * Labels are manually double checked, a lot of labeling mistakes were fixed. * Not balanced due to the natural frequency of signs. (crosswalks are everywhere) * Contains images with no labels, mostly of False Positive detections. NOTE (20-02-24): Update to version 2. Added 2k new images and double checked the labels for mistakes. I appreciate any feedback, ideas or whatever you have to say, It's my first dataset and I'm trying to make it as good as I can. I'll probably add more classes in the future, there are a lot of unlabeled traffic signs present in the existing data.
